meaning_mnemonic: When the <radical>sun</radical> is out, you can see two <radical>Wolverine</radical>s and a <radical>turkey</radical> playing together, but only on a certain <kanji>weekday</kanji>. Which <kanji>day of the week</kanji> is it? I'll never tell you. It could be Sunday. It could be Monday. It could be any day of the week.
meaning_hint: Picture the majestic scene — two Wolverines (yes, there are two) and a turkey, frolicking in the sunlight together. It's one of those rare but regular natural occurrences that only happens once a week, on a particular day.
reading_mnemonic: Now that you know how to figure out what <kanji>day of the week</kanji> it is, you can start making <reading>yo</reading>gurt (よう). It can take up to 24 hours to make yogurt. Knowing which weekday it is at any given moment means you can perfect your yogurt-making schedule.
reading_hint: Picture yourself looking at the shadow cast by the two Wolverines and the turkey. Imagine waiting a whole 24 hours and knowing exactly when your yogurt is ready. All thanks to this makeshift sundial which can accurately tell you which day of the week it is.
